column1: #Text=Polycrystalline LPMO samples were synthesized by using the solid-state reaction route.
#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of La2O3, PbO and MnCO3 powders were mixed together and calcinated at 1473 K for 24 h in Pt crucible with intermediate heating and grinding.
#Text=All high-temperature treatments were performed at ambient atmosphere with a programed heating and cooling rate of 50 K h−1.

#Text=The samples were characterized using x-ray powder diffraction (XRPD) at 295 K by using Cu Kβ radiation (Bruker D8 Advance diffractometer) with a step size of 0.013◦ (counting time was 15 s per step).
#Text=The oxidation states of the samples were determined by using x-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS).
#Text=A ‘PHI Quantera II’ system with an Al- Kα x-ray source and a hemispherical electron energy analyzer with pass energy of 26.00 eV were used to collect the XPS spectra.

#Text=The magnetic measurements were performed using a superconducting quantum interference device based quantum design magnetometer (MPMS) in the temperature range from 390 K to 5 K with a maximum field of 5 T.
